intro: Maieta scabrosa, commonly known as the rough maieta, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it grows in grassland and rocky habitats. The plant is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that appear in umbels. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to lanceolate, and often covered in fine pubescence. Maieta scabrosa is typically found in dry, well-drained soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates.
